Emprender Paz- private sector and peace award

description.narrative:
CORPORACION EMPRENDER PAZ has applied to Sida for funding of 3 million SEK to carry out the project “EMPRENDER PAZ AWARD” for the period 1 July 2016 - 31 June 2019
The project aims at promoting the positive contribution that the private sector can bring in generation of sustainable economic opportunities for the population affected by the armed conflict and thereby supporting peace building. Through raising awareness activities directed to private companies, increased visibility of positive experiences and the possibility to strengthen the initiatives, it is aimed at incentive more companies to be committed to and actively participating in the development of peace-building initiatives as part of their core business. The prize is awarded annually to four private sector initiatives that are chosen based on predetermined criteria and a rigorous selection process. The project total budget is 5,5 million SEK, of which Sweden will contribute with the 54%.

Corporación Emprender Paz har ansökt om finansiering till Sida om 3 miljoner SEK för att genomföra insats ”Emprender Paz Award” under perioden 1 st juli 2016 – 31 june 2019. Insatsen förväntas främja att den privata sektorn bidrar positivt till möjligheter inom hållbar ekonomisk utveckling för den av konflikten utsatta befolkningen och därmed bidra till hållbart fredsbyggande. Genom att genomföra påverkansarbete med privata företag, ökad synlighet och förstärkning av goda erfarenheter, har insatsen som målsättning att skapa incitament för fler företag att engagera sig och aktivt delta i utvecklingen av fredsbyggande initiativ som del av företagens kärnverksamhet. Ett pris delas ut årligen till fyra initiativ från privata sektorn och välj utifrån förbestämda kriterier och en rigorös utvalsprocess.

Decision on major amendment-55190020- Emprender Paz private sector and peace award

description.narrative:
The general context in 2020 was terribly affected by the Covid 19 global pandemic that resulted in the Colombian economy suffering a fall of 6.8% in GDP. The lockdown measures affected many enterprises and the unemployment rate rose from 10.5% in 2019 to 15.9% in 2020. In addition, illegal armed groups continued to impact human security with homicides, child recruitment and attacks against civilians.
In those circumstances, the call for proposals for the award, that normally takes place during the first half of the year, was moved to the second half. During the first few months, the CEP adapted their activities by updating the registration form with: clearer evaluation criteria; a simpler way to fill out the form virtually; and by asking companies to provide information on how they have dealt with the Covid 19 situation. The budget was also updated to show how a reduction in travel expenditure has allowed for an increase in incentives for the winners and improved communication strategies. The call for proposals was then open from August the 24th to October the 9th, 2020. The first technical committee took place on October the 19th,2020 and the first meeting of the Jury was held on October the 27th, 2020. The CEP team then took 5 weeks to conduct verification visits to the nine finalists, four virtually and six physically. The final Jury meeting was held on November the 30th, 2020 and the award ceremony took place on December the 10th, 2020 when four newly awarded companies joined the selected group of 48 companies with best practices and initiatives in peace building. The award ceremony was conducted virtually, with 708 participants.
The call for proposals for 2020 received 104 nominations of enterprises from different sectors (services 60%, agriculture 23%, agribusiness 11% and industry 9%) and sizes (micro 68%; large 25%; small 5%; and medium 0,1%). The total number of participants decreased from 124 in 2019, however, given the circumstances, the number was assessed as high. The 10 selected finalists together benefit more than 5731 people (2944 women and 2787 men) in 30 Departments. From these 10 finalists, the jury selected the following four winners: 1. Asopistar,2. Acefuver, 3. Corporacion Interactuar and 4. Terpel, as companies with the best peace building initiatives in 2020. These companies have invested 6,322 million COP (approximately 1.7 million USD in the awarded initiatives, showing their commitment and ownership.
Following the lessons learned in previous years, some changes were introduced in 2020. First, the amount of money for technical assistance was increased as the amount in previous years was too low to have any real impact on the initiatives and sometimes local consultants do not have the capacity to provide added value to local associations. The other change was that, in addition to technical assistance, the winner can also choose training or specialized machinery. Hence, the 2020 winners were placed from one to four in order of merit and will receive different incentives: the winner, Asopistar, will receive machinery amounting to 35 million COP. Acefuver, in second place, will also receive machinery amounting to 20 million COP. Interactuar, in third place, will receive technical assistance worth 15 million COP and finally, Terpel, in the fourth place, will receive technical assistance valued at 10 million COP
The technical assistance for the winners in 2019, that was initially planned to be provided in 2020, was postponed due to the pandemic. Last year, it was only possible to provide it to Agricapital as in that case, the consultancy could be done virtually. This company is part of the financial sector and won because of the innovative combination of soft loans with technical support to small peasant farmers in rural areas. They wanted to develop a technical tool to manage loans requests and integrate these with the whole information system, response channels and clients. The consultancy was completed in June 2020 and the impact, in terms of a reduction in the amount of time needed for analysing and placing loans, will be measured in 2021. The other three awarded initiatives for 2019 as well as those four awarded for 2020 will receive the award in 2021.
In addition, the media publicity and public recognition is another important part of the award. The communication strategy has been developed in 2020 by the firm, Acerca. The awarded initiatives and the call for proposals were publicised in 24 different reports: 6 in the printed press, 14 in the digital press and 2 on radio and 2 on TV. This coverage was less than the previous the year, but it reached 75% more people than in 2019 because the advertising was better focused on the target audiences and occurred during prime time viewing and listening. Due to the pandemic, it was not possible to promote the award in conjunction with editors, through national events or workshops with Chambers of Commerce, as in previous years. However, the media strategy is still assessed by the Embassy as effective.
The final, important outcome was the inclusion of a new Partner as the donor of the award. The Spanish foundation “Ayuda en Acción” that has worked in Colombia since 2006 contributed through media visibility and by increasing the award incentive for the winners. The Embassy has always insisted on the need to increase the number of partners and donors to improve the sustainability of the award, so the participation of this Foundation was also very much seen as a positive development.
The Embassy’s assessment is that the Emprender Paz Corporation adapted the planned activities to the Covid 19 crisis with virtual award ceremony and new incentives to motivate companies to participate. The narrative, financial and audit reports were approved.
